Description: Three joining fragments of rim and handle of pottery rosette bowl. Top of rim and horizontal handle painted black, dot rosette in black below the rim and three black bands on lower body (fired red in places).
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 227, no. 136)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 115, pl. XXXVI, no. 327.3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GK.69)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4822 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
